content: Classic copy and pasted typos :rolling_eyes:
rodzilla has marked this topic as resolved.

Yes in the cfg declaration (sprinkled all over my code). You get a nice error message if you try to cargo run / test the code with a bad feature name however if you have a non-existent feature name in your cfg declarations, it just runs and doesn't mention that there is no feature declared in Cargo.toml with that name.
@rodzilla We've had discussions about passing in a list of all available feature names, so that any non-existent features would get a warning. I'd love to see that happen.

If you or someone else can point me to the relevant area in the source code I'd be happy to look into it. I've been looking for an interesting entry point to contribute and this is a relevant problem for me to solve.
